text: Edward Collins (1882 – 1955) was an English footballer who played as a defender for Bilston United, Birmingham Veritas, Wolverhampton Wanderers, Sunbeam Motors, Newport County, and Hednesford Town. ==Playing career== Collins played for Bilston United, Birmingham Veritas, and Wolverhampton Wanderers. He played for Wolves in the 1908 FA Cup Final as they beat Newcastle United 3–1 at Crystal Palace. He joined Port Vale as a guest in September 1916, and made his debut at right-back in a 0–0 draw with Liverpool at the Athletic Ground in a Football League, Lancashire Regional Section match on 9 September. He became a regular in the first team, and played in a 2–2 home draw with Bury two weeks later despite having worked through the previous night until 6 am in Wolverhampton. He left Port Vale in September 1917, and later played for Sunbeam Motors, Newport County, and Hednesford Town. He died in 1955. ==Statistics== Source: {| class="wikitable" style="text- align:center;" |- !rowspan="2"|Club !rowspan="2"|Season !rowspan="2"|Division !colspan="2"|League !colspan="2"|FA Cup !colspan="2"|Total |- !Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals |- |rowspan="9"|Wolverhampton Wanderers |1907–08||Second Division||33||0||7||0||40||0 |- |1908–09||Second Division||37||0||2||0||39||0 |- |1909–10||Second Division||29||0||1||0||30||0 |- |1910–11||Second Division||36||0||3||0||39||0 |- |1911–12||Second Division||37||0||4||0||41||0 |- |1912–13||Second Division||38||0||2||0||40||0 |- |1913–14||Second Division||37||0||2||0||39||0 |- |1914–15||Second Division||37||0||2||0||39||0 |- !colspan="2"|Total !284!!0!!23!!0!!307!!0 |} ==Honours== ;Wolverhampton Wanderers *FA Cup winner: 1908 ==References== Category:1882 births Category:1955 deaths Category:Sportspeople from Wolverhampton Category:English footballers Category:Association football defenders Category:Bilston Town F.C. players Category:Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C. players Category:Newport County A.F.C. players Category:Hednesford Town F.C. players Category:English Football League players Category:Port Vale F.C. wartime guest players
